click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.strong: Welcome to the SPS webpage for students, families and caregivers.

div.p: Our goal is to help our students remain actively engaged in learning during the school closure.
We encourage students to keep practicing the skills they have been working on in their courses of study.

li.p: Under the "School" tab at the top of this page, you will find links to specific schools and grade levels where you can find additional advice, links and other resources. These resources were assembled by our SPS teachers to support learning during the hiatus.
The "Digital Resources" tab contains links to some sites prepared by Google with activities to engage students.

div.p: Students with disabilities and English learners who normally receive specialized instruction should expect additional communications directly from their Special Education or English as a Second Language Teachers.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

em.strong: he Department of Elementary and Secondary Education

span.style: font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.a: this list of supplemental resources for families.

span.strong: The SPS technology department will do our best to help you. Please email us
if you need advice. Remember, the SPS chromebooks only work with student SPS gmail accounts.
